DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effect dietary composition energy expenditure chronic disease risk factor , also explore physiological mechanism underlie effect .
DOC.detailed_description: Many overweight obese people lose weight month , difficulty maintain weight loss long term . One explanation poor long-term outcome weight-loss diet relate behavior , motivation adhere restrictive regimen typically diminishes time . An alternative explanation weight loss elicits biological adaptation - specifically decline energy expenditure increase hunger - promote weight regain . The purpose study evaluate effect dietary composition energy expenditure risk chronic disease , also explore physiological mechanism underlie effect . The study perform collaboration Framingham State University , provide novel feasible method feed subject din hall monitor compliance . Following 12±2 % weight loss standard run-in diet , 150 adult ( age 18 65 year ) randomly assign one three weight-loss maintenance diet control protein content ( 20 % energy ) vary widely dietary carbohydrate-to-fat ratio : Low-carbohydrate ( 20 % energy carbohydrate , 60 % fat ) , Moderate- carbohydrate ( 40 % carbohydrate , 40 % fat ) , High-carbohydrate ( 60 % carbohydrate , 20 % fat ) . During weight-loss maintenance phase , energy intake adjust prevent change body weight . The primary outcome change total energy expenditure ( indirect calorimetry use stable isotope ) 20 week . Secondary outcome weight maintenance include energy intake , rest energy expenditure ( indirect calorimetry use respiratory gas exchange ) , physical activity ( accelerometry ) , measure insulin resistance skeletal muscle work efficiency , component metabolic syndrome , hormonal metabolic measure might inform understanding physiological mechanism . We also assess voluntary food intake weight change 2-week ad libitum feed phase , objective measure dietary effect hunger . The analytic framework address study hypothesis repeated-measures analysis variance , adjustment covariates ( sex , race , ethnicity , age , anthropometrics , insulin sensitivity secretion , obesity-related gene ) . We also test covariate effect modification ( covariate × diet interaction ) .
DOC.criteria: Aged 18 65 year BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 Weight ≤ 425 lbs Medical clearance primary care provider Plans matriculate Framingham State University ( campusbased participant : student ) , work campus ( campusbased participant : faculty staff ) , live great Framingham area ( communitybased participant ) throughout academic year enrollment study Academic social clearance FSU Office Enrollment Student Development ( student participant ) willingness comply Criminal Offender Record Information ( CORI ) check Sex Offender Registry Information ( SORI ) check ( communitybased subject ) Willingness eat drink food beverage study menus participation , food allergy aversion Willingness eat din hall Willingness abstain consume alcohol participation Change body weight exceed ±10 % prior year Recent adherence special diet Recent adherence vigorous physical activity regimen ( e.g. , participation varsity sport ) Chronic use medication dietary supplement could affect study outcomes Current smoking ( 1 cigarette last week ) Heavy baseline alcohol consumption ( > 10 drinks/week ) history binge drinking ( ≥ 5 drink 1 day , anytime past 6 month ) Physician diagnosis major medical/psychiatric illness eat disorder Abnormal HgA1c , TSH , BUN , creatinine ; hematocrit < 30 ; ALT > 200 % normal upper limit Plans vacation study would preclude adherence prescribe diet Additional exclusion female participant : Irregular menstrual cycle ; change birth control medication 3 month prior enrollment ; pregnancy lactation 12 month prior enrollment
